title: cmd/go: diamond CGO dependency produces a symbol collision
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?

        go version go1.6.3 darwin/amd64

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?

        GOARCH="amd64"
        GOBIN=""
        GOEXE=""
        GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
        GOHOSTOS="darwin"
        GOOS="darwin"
        GOPATH="/Users/colin/golang"
        GORACE=""
        GOROOT="/usr/local/go"
        GOTOOLDIR="/usr/local/go/pkg/tool/darwin_amd64"
        GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT="1"
        CC="clang"
        GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fno-caret-diagnostics -Qunused-arguments -fmessage-length=0 -fno-common"
        CXX="clang++"
        CGO_ENABLED="1"

3. What did you do?

 - Clone https://github.com/stripe/sequins
 - Check out https://github.com/stripe/sequins/commit/011971aa3b593f169f8f53a7e07d427377f4bcb8 (the `compressed-sequencefiles` branch)
 - Run `make sequins`.

4. What did you expect to see?

  Successful build output!

5. What did you see instead?

  It's failing to build on the last step with duplicate symbols:

        duplicate symbol _snappy_compress in:
            /var/folders/3d/ymqb8kcx5jv4s2gsqy7rd83h0000gn/T/go-link-410495653/000000.o
            /var/folders/3d/ymqb8kcx5jv4s2gsqy7rd83h0000gn/T/go-link-410495653/000003.o

I can also reproduce on linux; here's a [travis build](https://api.travis-ci.org/jobs/146532902/log.txt?deansi=true).

The issue seems to be that I have a diamond dependency on a local static library. I vendor and build a version of snappy, which is in turn used by [sparkey](https://github.com/spotify/sparkey), which I also build, and that is in turn used by a vendored version of [go-sparkey](https://github.com/bsm/go-sparkey), which is used in my app.

That had all been working fine (you can check out the `1.0` branch to see it in action). The issue arose when I introduced another dependency on snappy, in [`sequencefile/snappy.go`](https://github.com/stripe/sequins/blob/011971aa3b593f169f8f53a7e07d427377f4bcb8/sequencefile/snappy.go). Then the build started breaking.

To summarize, the dependency graph looks like this (see the [Makefile](https://github.com/stripe/sequins/blob/011971aa3b593f169f8f53a7e07d427377f4bcb8/Makefile) for reference):

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/821775/17043715/4c4c306e-4f6e-11e6-93b1-e88db28a87b6.png)

Everything was working before I added the brach on the right; the [linked commit](https://github.com/stripe/sequins/commit/011971aa3b593f169f8f53a7e07d427377f4bcb8) contains the full set of changes that break the build.

Thanks in advance for the help! Sorry this is gnarly.
